text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Majali says will try to reduce foreign labour to create more jobs for umemployed Jordanians.
- Royal decree passed on an amended publications and press law which toughens fines on journalists who breach its articles.
- Stock prices rise sharply on Amman Financial Market on back of foreign buying spree.
- Crown Prince Hassan says Jordan's social safety net projects to rehabilitate refugee camps are not attempt to liquidate Palestinian refugee problem.
- Jordan to ask Paris Club to reschedule foreign debt.
- King praises troops for their services.
- Crown Prince receives Canadian Mideast envoy.
